body:
Most of the existing consumers use ioctl()-based interfaces, so I think it's perfectly fine to provide that interface for now.  You're really just getting Solaris to match the status quo on other platforms where Go is used.

Personally, I think #12101 can cover the more general, higher-level abstractions that Go should have in the long-run for terminal manipulation.  I wouldn't worry about exposing the tc*() functions for now -- that really seems like a separate issue.
